poem:
Survive to 2025

In the thin thread
of survival, small
companies grasp

tight — pennies fall,
ideas scatter
like dust in bright Glasgow,

a nation holds
its breath in brief
tremor. Cut

deep, slashed
dreams bleed into
screens, a lull

in creation
echoes in our living rooms,

survive – they whisper –
to 2025.
